alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 17 at 8:17PM CDT until April 17 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONROE AND CONECUH COUNTIES... At 816 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Uriah, or 10 miles southwest of Frisco City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management reported golf ball sized hail in Uriah in southern Monroe county. This is a dangerous storm and will likely result in hail damage. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Evergreen, Frisco City, Peterman, Uriah, Excel, Repton and I65 And US 84. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
